item.title: Blocked Footpath, 3rd October
item.description:
On the foot path at the end of Silwood Street underneath the railway archers there is now a massive metal gate. This is the direct walkway to Millwall The Den, there is no details on how long this blockage is on for and there is no signs at Surrey Quays railway station telling fans that there is a diversary route Enclosed is a picture of the footpath underneath the railway arches before it was blocked off by this fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silwood Street, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop S Hall Road closure, 3rd October
item.description:
Https://ukpowernetworks.my.salesforce.com/apex/AFSC__UrlCheck?id=05a0KSr00000GhcopMAB (https:??one?network??GB143411525) Hi, regarding the above roadworks which have permit number EC40022508831, why has this necessitated the closure of my local bus stop? My bus stop is Hall Road Stop S towards Baker Street which is ahead of the junction following which the UKPN roadworks commence. My bus passes this stop everyday notwithstanding the single lane closure at the junction, but I am forced to walk 100m down the road to the Lords cricket ground stop instead. Please reopen the Hall Road bus stop S, it's closure is not necessitated by these roadworks and is causing a lot of inconvenience to residents who depend on it. Picture attached of the bus stop in proximity to the junction leading to the road works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Grove End Road, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
